result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin J. Walczak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**The Court directs that if Mr. Walczak pays the restitution by the end of probation term (6/29/17) will be discharged; if does not pay the restitution then probation is extended for 6 months.**

10/10/17: This request (termination of probation) is granted effective 10/13/17. COC will prepare an Amended JOC to reflect 10/13/17 termination date. Outstanding financial obligations, as determined by COC, shall be reduced to civil judgment(s).

Case called at 12:10pm [mo]
Defendant Dustin J. Walczak in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 9 months, with conditions:

--Anger Management counseling and follow through with recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse modifier
--to pay restitution to Jeffrey and Kimberly Rose in the amount of $113.88
--to provide DNA sample to designee upon demand


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 12:16pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-29-2015 11:00 am

Case called at 9:54am [mo]
[Scheduled for Initial Appearance and Plea/Sentencing today]
Defendant Dustin J. Walczak in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Karl Huebner does NOT appear

ADA Beck confirms victim rights compliance as to hearing and Stipulation & Order

The Court addresses the Proposed Stipulation & Order that was submitted to the Court
--The Court grants the Stipulation & Order for Continuance

The Court directs the State coordinate with Atty. Huebner and the Court's JA to schedule a new hearing date and time no later than 10/26/15 at 4:00pm.
recess: 9:59am
Proposed stip for continuance
Proposed Stipulation & Order for Continuance for 10/19/15 Hearing
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-19-2015 10:00 am
Initial appearance at 10-19-2015 10:00 am

Case called at 3:04pm [mo]
[Scheduled for Hearing of Victim Rights Compliance]
Defendant Dustin J. Walczak does not appear in court.
Attorney Karl Huebner appears in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews Court Record
Upon inquiry of the Court, DA Happ confirms that the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint was a tenant of the property damaged and that the owner of the property, Kimberly Rose would like to be heard on restitution.
Upon inquiry of the Court, DA Happ indicates that on the day of Sentencing, ADA Shock contacted Ms. Livermoore, with the understanding at that time, that she (Ms. Livermoore) was the victim.
Upon questioning of the Court, DA Happ confirms that Kimberly Rose, the owner of the property, is the victim of this criminal action 
The Court vacates the Judgement Of Conviction and the Court's sentence

The Court directs DA Happ to submit an Amended Criminal Complaint to the Court with the proper victim listed. 
recess: 3:14pm--reconvene:3:16pm [for scheduling]

Atty. Huebner indicates that he does not have an explanation for Mr. Walczak; except that Mr. Walczak may have received the proposed stipulation and order for continuance in the mail and interpreted it as not having to appear at todays hearing.
The Court will send notice of the hearing scheduled. 

The Court imposes a new bond, which should have the same monetary and non-monetary conditions as previously ordered in this case. This bond is be signed no later than 3:30pm on Friday 8/28/2015
recess: 3:21pm



NEXT:Initial Appearance/Plea & Sentencing/Restitution Hearing on 10/19/15 at 10:00am
It is Ordered that the 8/25/15 Restitution Hearing will be transformed to a victim rights compliance hearing. Restitution will be addressed at at later date.
Proposed stip for continuance
Restitution hearing at 08-25-2015 03:00 pm
Completed Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission Paperwork
with elements and criminal case settlement
Scheduling Notice
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission w/fax confirmation

Case called at 11:04am 
Defendant Dustin J. Walczak in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds the warrant it issued earlier to be satisfied by Mr. Walczak's personal appearance.
ADA Shock indicates that victim rights is not complied with to proceed to plea and sentencing, the Court suggests attempting to contact the victim
recess: 11:08am--reconvene:11:19am [to allow ADA Shock to contact the victim]
ADA Shock indicates that the victim approves  proceeding with plea and sentencing, but would like to be heard on restitution. Further, ADA Shock suggests the Court proceed with plea and sentencing today and then have a restitution hearing at a later date, with the possibility of a stipulation being submitted in the interim.
--The Court and Defense agree


Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Joint Motion of the Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--anger management counseling and follow through with recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or  counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--to submit DNA sample upon demand to designee/Sheriff
--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 11:45am 

NEXT: Restitution Hearing: 8/25/2015 at 3:00pm

Case called at 10:13am [mo]
Defendant Dustin J. Walczak does not appear in court. Attorney Karl Huebner appears in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Huebner indicates that he attempted to call Mr. Walczak and reached his mother, who indicated Mr. Walczak should be at the courthouse.
The Court reviews the court record; including notice of hearings 
The Court issues a bench warrant, shall Mr. Walczak be taken into custody he can be released on $500 cash, so long as the bond has a new hearing date and time.
ADA Shock orally motions the bond to be forfeited
The Court finds the bond to be in default and orders that it be forfieted.
The Court finds probable cause to exist within the Criminal Complaint to support both counts.
recess: 10:17am
Attorney Karl Huebner
Status conference at 07-21-2015 10:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 07-15-2015 10:20 am
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 2:16 pm [sf]
[Commissioner Onheiber presiding for Br. 2]
Defendant Dustin J. Walczak in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Tracy Livermore or his younger sister

Attorney Svehlek advises that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.

Recess: 2:19 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 7/15/15 at 10:20 am
Status: 7/21/15 at 10:00 am
